Short Descriptor: Waist circumference (inches), average of two measurements
Allowable Codes:
20-60
888 = Unknown or not assessed
-4 = Not available: UDS form submitted did not collect data in this way, or a skip pattern precludes response to this question
TT code:
v1-3: -4
v4: If WAIST1=888 or WAIST2=888, then =888. Else average(WAIST1, WAIST2).

Short Descriptor: Participant blood pressure (average of two readings), systolic, left arm
Allowable Codes:
70-230
888 = Unknown or not assessed
-4 = Not available: UDS form submitted did not collect data in this way, or a skip pattern precludes response to this question
Description/derivation: In November 2020, a standard procedure for measuring blood pressure was introduced to UDSv3 and subsequent versions. When blood pressure is not measured using the standard protocol, NACCBPSYSL=-4.
TT code:
v1-2: -4
v3: If BPSYS=777, then=BPSYSL. Else =-4.
v4: If BPSYSL1=888 or BPSYSL2=888, then =888. Else average(BPSYSL1, BPSYSL2).

Allowable Codes:
10.0 – 100.0 
888.8 = Unknown or not assessed 
-4 = Not available: UDS form submitted did not collect data in this way, or a skip pattern precludes response to this question
Description/derivation: Body mass index is derived using variables height (pounds) and weight (inches). The standardized calculation used is as follows: BMI = ( weight (lbs) × 703) ÷ height (in) 2 If height or weight is missing or unknown, then naccbmi =888. If Form B1 was not submitted, then naccbmi = -4.
